page.title: 11Tourism-Beamish
page.content:
{BEAMISH HALL
Beamish Hall is the headquarters of the museum. The estate has been owned by the Davison and Eden families and the Shafto family.Famous members of these families have included Lord Avon, formerly Sir Anthony Eden,and the 'Bobby Shafto' of the famous song of that name. Within the Hall itself is an exhibition of everyday items from yesteryear ranging from old bottles, enamelled notices,cameras,pit lamps and vacuum cleaners to old school desks and pots and pans.A reference library and photographic and sound archives are also based in the Hall.
